abstract.p: Cadbury Schweppes PLC will expand its relationship with Young & Rubicam Advertising by naming agency to handle its consolidated worldwide advertising account for its Schweppes brand; account, with billings estimated at $40 million to $50 million, was previously divided among three agencies including Young & Rubicam (S)

block.p: Cadbury Schweppes P.L.C. in London said yesterday that it had expanded its relationship with Young & Rubicam Advertising by naming that agency to handle its consolidated worldwide advertising account for its Schweppes brand. The account, with billings estimated at $40 million to $50 million, was previously divided among three agencies including Y.& R.

Y.& R., which has handled the Schweppes account in Australia, was awarded the consolidated account after a six-week review that also included the two other Schweppes incumbents: Foote, Cone & Belding, a unit of True North Communications, which had handled the brand in the United States and Latin America, and Saatchi & Saatchi P.L.C., which has handled the brand in Europe and Hong Kong.

Cadbury Schweppes P.L.C. in London said yesterday that it had expanded its relationship with Young & Rubicam Advertising by naming that agency to handle its consolidated worldwide advertising account for its Schweppes brand. The account, with billings estimated at $40 million to $50 million, was previously divided among three agencies including Y.& R.

Y.& R., which has handled the Schweppes account in Australia, was awarded the consolidated account after a six-week review that also included the two other Schweppes incumbents: Foote, Cone & Belding, a unit of True North Communications, which had handled the brand in the United States and Latin America, and Saatchi & Saatchi P.L.C., which has handled the brand in Europe and Hong Kong.

Y.& R. Europe in London will serve as the lead agency on the account, which includes advertising for the Schweppes brands including ginger ale, club soda and tonic water, as well as other soft drinks. The assignment is the most recent example of a big account consolidated at Y.& R., coming after consolidations by Groupe Danone, Citicorp and Colgate-Palmolive.
